newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian Kaolin finalises A$53 mln issue.
newsitem.headline: Australian Kaolin finalises A$53 mln issue.

text.p: Australian Kaolin NL said on Thursday it had finalised an A$53.9 million share placement and rights issue which will fund construction of the company's kaolin mine and processing plant in Queensland.

Australian Kaolin said it plans to raise A$42 million by placing 140 million shares at 30 cents each with domestic and international clients of Paterson Ord Minnett Ltd, which will underwrite the rights issue.
A fully-underwritten renounceable 1-for-two rights issue at 30 cents a share will raise another A$11.9 million.
The issue and placement price compares with Australian Kaolin's market price of 37 cents by 0230 GMT (12.30 p.m.).
The placement is due for approval at a June 5 shareholders meeting and is subject to obtaining appropriate supporting debt facilities.

"The company will now have the funds to proceed immediately with the development of its mining and processing facilities at Skardon River and we should be ready to start production in the middle of next year," Graham Keys, Australian Kaolin's executive director, said in a statement.
The Skardon River plant will have an initial capacity of 175,000 tonnes of kaolin a year.
The company said it had signed distribution agreements and letters of intent with international trading houses for all of the first year's production.
